thread.title_full: Australian weather forecast: Cold front coming this weekend | Technology | Tech News and Latest New Technology | | The Advertiser

author: Michael Morrow
title: Australian weather forecast: Cold front coming this weekend | Technology | Tech Latest New Technology
text:
SNOW has started to fall as the big freeze begins to impact the nation’s south east, where sub-zero temperatures are forecast in some places for much of the coming week.
Weather experts say the intense cold front and associated low pressure system will cause widespread cold temperatures for two thirds of Australia.
Alpine areas of Victoria and New South Wales are already feeling the effects with snowfalls overnight at the major ski resorts.
Later on the weekend, snowfalls will impact areas that rarely see it, even some towns in Queensland are expecting a dusting.
Here’s a look at how cold it’s going to be at your place.
NEW SOUTH WALES and ACT
Cold weather has already developed in the south and is expected to move north on Saturday and continue until Thursday.
Snow is already falling at the major ski resorts and will develop in the Blue Mountains on Saturday and move north along the ranges, all the way to the Queensland border.
Snow day ... Snow started dumping down at Perisher early this morning. Picture: Ski.com.au Source: Instagram
Towns that are expecting a dumping of the white stuff include, Katoomba, Orange, Lithgow, Bathurst, Glen Innes, Guyra and Armidale with maximum temperatures between 2C and 6C.
The icy conditions will arrive in Sydney on Sunday with a top of 15C, but with the wind chill, it will feel much colder.
The temperature is not expected to push past 16C until the end of next week.
Canberra will freeze with a maximum of 7C on Sunday with possible snow and sleet.
Bondi sunrise ... Sydney beaches won’t look like today on the weekend. Picture: Instagram/Alyssa Anderson Source: Instagram
VICTORIA
Conditions are likely to deteriorate across the state during the day tomorrow as the strong cold front moves in from the south.
Bitterly cold winds and hail are likely to effect large areas on Sunday and Monday with snow falling to low levels, possibly in the higher suburbs of Melbourne and in Ballarat, where the temperature is only forecast to reach 6C.
The entire state will remain in the grip of the cold snap with temperatures remaining in the low teens until at least Thursday.
Melbourne can expect a top of 11C on Sunday, and 12C for the next week.
Dumping ... Snowboarders getting ready to hit the slopes at Falls Creek this morning. Picture: Instagram/danielmharrop Source: Instagram
SOUTH AUSTRALIA
The Antarctic blast will reach South Australia tonight bringing rain and the chance of thunderstorms with hail.
Snow is possible in the hills surrounding Adelaide and other areas across the state above 800m tomorrow and on Sunday.
Temperatures should hover in the mid teens for the next week with overnight temperatures in the south between 5C and 7C, with colder conditions inland and in the north.
The state’s capital is heading for a top of 12C tomorrow and the chilly weather won’t ease up until the end of next week.
Rare sight ... Hundreds are expected to wait for the snow at Mt Lofty in the Adelaide Hills. Picture: Campbell Brodie. Source: News Corp Australia
QUEENSLAND
The Sunshine state will also feel the effects of this significant weather event as the polar air mass moves north over the weekend.
Unusually cold weather is likely to sweep in to southern areas on Sunday dropping temperatures and possibly bringing snow to Stanthorpe near the NSW border.
Maximum temperatures there are unlikely to push above 10C until Wednesday.
Brisbane won’t escape the deep freeze either with a forecast maximum of just 15C on Monday with overnight temperatures dipping to 6C for most of the week.
Queensland snow ... Cold conditions are common in Stanthorpe, snows not. Source: Supplied
TASMANIA
The Apple Isle can expect to suffer through a week of very cold weather in the wake of this weekend’s cold front.
Snowfalls are likely to develop in alpine areas from late today and continue next week, particularly in the Central Plateau District and the South West.
Hobart will shiver with maximum temperatures between 11C and 13C for the next seven days.
Frozen ... Snow is expected to fall down to 1000m in Tasmania. Picture: Yvonne Joseph Source: Supplied
WESTERN AUSTRALIA
Even though this cold front missed the south west corner of WA, a high pressure system will deliver cold conditions to large areas of the state.
Some towns across the southern half, including Narrogin and Southern Cross, are likely to see near freezing conditions overnight for the next week.
Widespread areas of frost are possible.
Daytime temperatures in Perth will hover around 17C with night time minimum’s of between 3C and 5C.
Wintry blast ... Perth city engulfed in a cold fog viewed from Kings Park at 7am yesterday. The city recorded its coldest night of the year with a minimum of 0.8C. Source: News Corp Australia
NORTHERN TERRITORY
Southern areas of the NT will also be blasted by icy winds as the cold front passes to the south tomorrow.
Tourist area’s around Alice Springs and Uluru will shiver through an unusual run of freezing minimum temperatures.
Alice Springs will have overnight lows of between 0C and 3C until next Thursday, with the possibility of morning frost.
Meanwhile, Darwin seems to be the place to be with maximum temperatures forecast of 32C for the weekend.
Desert freeze ... southern areas of the NT are likely to wake up to frosty mornings over the next week. Source: Supplied
Originally published as How cold it will get at your place
